ngoList.address: TT Ranganathan Clinical Research Foundation IV MainRoad-Indira agar 20
ngoList.title: TT Ranganathan Clinical Research Foundation
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Primary treatment for alcoholics and drug users TTK Hospital is a pioneering institution working in the field of addiction for more than 29 years. A one month treatment programme is offered to alcoholics and drug users with the goals of helping the clients to achieve total abstinence and also improve their quality of lives. We have also developed a family programme to empower families of addicts. Extended Care At The After Care Centre After care center was started in 1989 to cater to the drug dependent persons who were from younger age group: lacked family support and had no vocational skills or employment. The programme is residential and involves two months stay. The therapy aims at resolving blocks in recovery. Treatment provided here includes medical help; psychological therapy and long term follow-up. Computer education and special programme for families are also offered. From hospital based treatment to Community Supported Recovery The centre devised an innovative Rural Camp programme specially for the villagers making treatment available at their doorsteps. Here the recovery of the clients takes place through the help of the empowered individuals who subsequently transform the village community into a mighty enabling force to combat alcoholism. 5 to 6 rural camps are conducted each year making effective use of the resources available in the community. So far in the last 20 years TTK Hospital has conducted 114 camps in the villages of Tamil Nadu. In each camp 25 to 30 patients have been treated. Relapse prevention and management support Relapse programme addresses the needs of relapsed clients; guides them through their relapse prevention and management programmes and equips them with special skills to handle triggers and other high risk situations so that they can manage their recovery process better. There is a special programme for patients for five days and a parallel programme for family members. Clients who have one or two days of drinking or slip are dealt by providing immediate admission or out patient detoxification. Vocational Rehabilitation at Tejas Many drug dependents have no occupational skills; no work ethics and have difficulty in retaining a job. For them recovery is not possible without vocational training. In 2000 to cater to this need, the TTK Hospital established Tejas, the vocational training center where recovering patients and their family members are provided free training in tailoring and computer education . Besides, there is a packing unit which is a drug free work place where they learn work ethics; earn their living and stabilize recovery. Regional Resource and Training Centre for southern region The Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment designated our organization as RRTC for Southern Region . We are mentoring more than 84 centres from Tamil Nadu; Karnataka; Kerala and Andhra Pradesh. We have conducted several training programmes of two days to one month duration. We have also developed the Minimum Standards of Care for the entire country

ngoList.title: UIT EDUCATIONAL TRUST
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: UIT was established in the year 2009 by the Alumini of Government College of Technology (GCT), Coimbatore and National Institute of Technology (NIT), Trichy in order to provide quality technical education in this region on par with international standard. The centre for Upskilling and Enhancement (CUE) has been established to enhance the technical skills and expertise of our staff and students. It aims at improving the creative capabilities of our staff and students through frequent interactions with the experts from industries and leading academic institutions. The Atmel Lab was established in 2010 in collaboration with Atmel University to create the thirst for taking up research based projects. The R&D section of ATMEL lab has been striving consistently to provide analytical and research oriented technical education to students. In collaboration with the ATMEL Corporation India, through the ATMEL MCU centre, research projects are undertaken by the students in the field of embedded systems like  Autonomous Guider for Visually Challenged Personalities  Real time automization of irrigation system for social modernization of Indian agriculture  Development of an android application for monitoring and controlling industrial motors using Wi-Fi technology The research work also extends to micro electro mechanical systems (MEMS) such as  Designing MEMS Based variometer for detecting the vertical speed of the AIRCRAFT in Avionics applications  Designing MEMS Based Bolometer for Detecting the Radiations in Nuclear Power Plants In order to provide sufficient knowledge on software and hardware to circuit branch students value added programs and workshops are regularly conducted through ATMEL MCU centre. The institute has installed Rovan Software for keeping a record of all relevant details related to students daily attendance, time table and other important activities. By making use of the facility Voice 2 Message the parents are regularly informed about the academic performance of their wards and the marks secured by them in the Internal Assessment Exam along with their attendance particulars. Learning Management System (LMS) aims at inducing the students to learn more about their subjects through a process of self learning. The session wise lessons, notes, relevant Questions along with appropriate answers are updated online, helping the students to improve their learning abilities and enhance their overall knowledge. An innovation centre has been founded in the college with the objective of improving the creative and the innovative talents of our students in solving pertinent day-to- day problems faced by the people in and around our region. The Placement and Training Cell has put up a splendid performance by helping 90% of the eligible students to find suitable placement in the last three years.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: V-Excel Educational Trust is a registered Public Charitable Trust and a professionally run NGO working in the field of Special Education, Rehabilitation and Livelihood development. It was started in 2001 by Dr. Vasudha Prakash, a professional academician and counselor who holds a Doctorate in Special Education from Rutgers University, New Jersey, USA. It is affiliated to Sringeri Sri Sharada Peetham. An experienced multi-disciplinary team of special educators, therapists, counsellors, administrators and skill trainers is committed to ensuring a better future for children and adults with disabilities. V-Excel works with children having mental and developmental disabilities such as Autism, Mental Retardation, Down Syndrome, Attention Deficit Disorder (ADD), Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD), Behavioural Disorders and Learning Disabilities like Dyslexia. Apart from this we work with teachers, parents, doctors and general public for different services. V-Excel is a lifespan umbrella organization, offering a wide range of services spans across all age groups and all service areas under one roof. We offer the following services - Special School, Counselling, Assessments, Remedial Services, Early Intervention, Sensory Integration, Occupational Therapy, Play-Music Art-Movement Therapies, Vocational Skills Development, Teacher Training, Outreach Programs, and Professional Workshops. V-Excel has eight centres across the country, 3 in Chennai and 1 satellite centre each in Tirunelveli-Erode-Srirangam (Trichy) in Tamil Nadu, and Nashik-Solapur in Maharashtra. We have been getting requests and aspire to set up many such smaller centres in Tier 2 towns. Our ultimate goal is to create an environment where individuals with special needs can grow to lead dignified, independent, and productive lives in society. V-Excels unique holistic approach focuses on all-round development of every individuals abilities, rather than their disabilities. Established as a quality service provider in education and rehabilitation, V-Excel has impacted well over 35,000 individuals with special needs across urban and rural areas. V-Excel and its Founder Dr. Vasudha Prakash have been recipients of many awards. It was a finalist in the prestigious India NGO Awards (in top 12 of the 350 NGOs) in 2015, many Rotary Awards, Woman of Excellence Award, Raj TV, Mother Teresa Award US-Asia Business Forum, Los Angeles, CA, USA. V-Excels sincere work in implementing Governments project, Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan (Education for All), was applauded and showcased at the meet of all state governments. Invited regularly to conduct educational workshops in schools, to give talks at Clubs (e.g. Rotary), to counsel and present at corporates (like Cognizant). V-Excel presented at two international conferences on disabilities - New York and Iceland -for their initiatives in Curative Education. V-Excel has a global perspective, professional approach and determination to facilitate a fuller life for the differently abled, which gives it a distinct edge in the Special Education sector.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Vidivelli Rural Development Society has been rendering its services to socially and economically weaker section of people since 1994 It has established home for the aged covering more than 30 aged at Mettukkadai village , Manapparai Tiruchi, The organization has been fullest human resource and infrastructure and hence it has established an Integrated Complex for the orphan adults, neglected adults, socially excluded adults, pro-poor adults of both sex (all whose age is above 60+) and for orphan children (age group 6 to 18), single parented children, destitute children and resource poor children in a single complex at Mathikonpatti, Thottiyapatti Post, Kovilpatty Via, Marungapuri Taluk, Trichirappalli District. The said Complex has been located at Marungapuri Union of Trichirappalli District.The Vidivelli Multi Facility Care Centre for 50 Older Widowed Women is adequately staffed to carry out the programme successfully. Vidivelli Rural Development Society has been established and running the Helpline Counseling Centre for older persons, being successful through management contribution, loans and public donations.

students who have failed in those standards and the primary Middle and higher standards especially to the SC ST students and economically poor with out collecting any fee from them under the assistance from the Central social Welfare Board and there fore we have applied for the same and we hope that we will get the assistance from the board 2 We have proposed to start the Computer Centre in Ammapettai block to cater the needs of the rural youths who were not able to study in payment centers and who have interest in information Technology For this we have applied for the assistance in NABARD and we hope that will also were will get 3 We have proposed to start the Tailoring institute to train the rural women to earn themselves under the Sponsorship of Nehru Yuva Kendra Thanjavur 4 have proposed to conduct the awareness programme in Child Rights to the parents and the children 7 We have proposed to start the awareness and demonstration camps on Nutrition and it is importance to the rural women in collaboration with National Nutrition Board of Pondichery 8 We have plan to expand our National Environment Programme on Tree plantation and vermi compost in entire block 9 We
